Convert ‘Beach Name’, ‘Community’, and ‘Violation’ fields to lowercase for reliable matching / filtering.
Keep only rows where Beach Type Description equals ‘Marine’.
Split EJ dataframe into two subsets: communities whose ‘Percent of population in EJ BGs’ is >50% and communities whose percentage is <25%.
Inner-merge the marine-only beach dataframe with each EJ subset (Community ↔ Municipality) to retain beach samples that belong to those EJ population brackets.
For each merged subset, compute bacterial exceedance rate: (number of rows whose Violation == 'yes') divided by total rows in subset, multiplied by 100.
Subtract the <25% EJ exceedance rate from the >50% EJ exceedance rate and output the difference (the result is rounded implicitly by print format / question requirement).
